title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for correct substitution.

∆G°298 = ∆H°298 – T∆S°298

1 point is earned for the value of ∆G°298 (including kJ or J).

= –264 kJ mol–1 – (298 K)(–0.278 kJ mol–1 K–1)

= –181 kJ mol–1

title: Part B

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for multiplying ∆H°298 by the number of moles of NF3 formed.

1 point is earned for recognizing that 2.00 mol of NF3 are produced for the reaction as it is written.

1 point is earned for the answer (including kJ or J).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct answer.

There are six N – F bonds formed.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for the correct answer.

There are six N – F bonds formed.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for the correct answer.

There are six N – F bonds formed.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct number of bonds in all three compounds multiplied by the average bond enthalpies.

∆H°298 = ∑Ebonds broken – ∑Ebonds formed = –264 kJ mol–1

= [ BEN=N + (3 x BEF-F) ] – (6 x BEN-F)

= [946 kJ mol–1 + (3 x BEF-F) ] – 6(272 kJ mol–1)

= –264 kJ mol–1

⇒ 3 mol BEF-F = (–264 – 946 + 1,632) kJ mol–1

1 point is earned for the answer (including kJ or J).

⇒ BEF-F = 141 kJ mol–1

Note: A total of one point is earned if an incorrect number of bonds is substituted in a correct equation and the answer is reasonable (i.e., positive).
